summary.p: Since his departure from Basel, he has not heard anything from Zurich, but assures Bullinger and the other superiors of his obedience; he is not in danger here and earns his living by giving lectures. Greetings.

div.p: Greetings. I have already written before, most esteemed father, about the state of my affairs. Whether you have received it, I do not know. For I have not received any letters from home since I left Basel. Therefore, I write again and earnestly beg you not to interpret my departure in any other way than I have done, as I am ready to comply with you and all those whom God has placed over me in all things. For what alone deterred me from this place, where I am now, I find in reality to be without danger. Otherwise, I live quite happily and earn my living by publicly lecturing. Therefore, I give thanks to the immortal God, who does not allow me to be forsaken anywhere.
Please convey my greetings to Mr. Jakob Amman and the other teachers, who are to be honored forever. February 20, 1540. In Paris, near the Plessis College on Rue Saint-Jacques, where three fish hang.
Otto Werdm√ºller, your most obedient son.
To the renowned Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, his lord and father to be honored forever. Zurich.
